title: Sherlock: The Riddle of the Crown Jewels

children.title: About

child.title: About PRIZM Invisiclues
child.content:
The PRIZM project (Pretty Reliable Invisiclues for Z-Machine) resulted from a collaboration between Digby McWiggle (digby_mcwiggle@hotmail.com) and Steven Marsh (marsh@netally.com, www.waitingforgo.com), with the aim of making the genuine Infocom invisiclues available as Z-Code computer files. The project was endorsed by Activision, who now hold the copyright for Infocom's material.

Whenever possible we have stayed faithful to the original printed Invisiclues booklets. Where both in-game and printed versions were available we have used the printed clues, as these were generally more detailed. Printing errors have been corrected whenever possible. The files have been formatted to display correctly on any screen with a width of at least 80 characters.

The home of the PRIZM project is www.waitingforgo.com. There you can download different versions of the files, with or without sample transcripts and missing documentation, and grouped by various classifications (unfortunately, limitations within the Z-Machine prevent all the invisiclues being packaged into one big file).

children.title: Credits

child.title: Credits
child.content:
Compiled, edited, and z-coded by:

Steven Marsh (marsh@netally.com, www.waitingforgo.com)

Digby McWiggle (digby_mcwiggle@hotmail.com)

from material supplied by:

Steven Marsh

Volker Blasius

Thanks also to:

Brian Hall

L. Ross Raszewski

Graham Nelson.

All material Copyright 1993, 1999 Activision, Inc. Used with permission.

This file Copyright 1999 Digby McWiggle & Steven Marsh.

Sherlock and all other game names are registered trade marks of Activision.

children.title: Starters

child.title: Starters

children.title: How do I get into the house?

child.title: How do I get into the house?
hints: Mrs Hudson is expecting you, so you shouldn't have to do anything too unusual.
Have you tried kicking down the door?
KNOCK ON THE DOOR.

children.title: How do I get into the parlour?

child.title: How do I get into the parlour?
hints: Mrs Hudson wants you to attend to something first.
Get Holmes's mind off the drug.

children.title: How do I get into the kitchen?

child.title: How do I get into the kitchen?
hints: Don't look at the next clue until you have opened the trap door in the hall.
You're cheating, aren't you?
There is no trap door.
There is no kitchen.
Don't let the existence of these questions influence your playing of the game.

children.title: How do I get into the bedroom?

child.title: How do I get into the bedroom?
hints: Only Holmes can open that door.
When the visitor leaves, Holmes will open it.

children.title: How do I get onto the roof?

child.title: How do I get onto the roof?
hints: The same way you got into the kitchen.

children.title: Will Mrs Hudson do anything for me?

child.title: Will Mrs Hudson do anything for me?
hints: Have you tried kissing her?
Have you tried bribing her?
The sad fact is that she won't do anything for you.

children.title: Can I get Holmes out of his stupor?

child.title: Can I get Holmes out of his stupor?
hints: Holmes is bored with the commonplace events of everyday life.
He needs some mental excitement.
Newspapers generally contain interesting items.
For a doctor, you're not too bright. Read him the newspaper. (Or tell him about the visitor).

children.title: Why does the clue paper exist?

child.title: Why does the clue paper exist?
hints: It looks like the thief is challenging Sherlock Holmes to a duel of wits.
Unlike yourself, Sherlock is not unarmed for such a duel.
The thief is laying down a trail of clues for Holmes to follow.

children.title: What's the answer to the 1st riddle?

child.title: What's the answer to the 1st riddle?
hints: The verse refers to a particular place.
The place is the spot where most English royalty is buried.
Westminster Abbey.

children.title: What's the answer to the 2nd riddle?

child.title: What's the answer to the 2nd riddle?
hints: The verse refers to the last of the Tudor monarchs.
She was called the "Virgin Queen."
Elizabeth I.

children.title: What's the answer to the 3rd riddle?

child.title: What's the answer to the 3rd riddle?
hints: The discoverer of the law of gravity.
Sir Isaac Newton.

children.title: What's the answer to the 4th riddle?

child.title: What's the answer to the 4th riddle?
hints: Don't read the next clue until you have thoroughly explored Westminster Abbey.
Have you looked around in the Jerusalem Chamber?
The fourth verse refers to Henry V.

children.title: Where is the lamp?

child.title: Where is the lamp?
hints: It's in Holmes's bedroom.

children.title: Who is the thief?

child.title: Who is the thief?
hints: Who do you think?

children.title: Cabs

child.title: Cabs

children.title: How do I hail a cab?

child.title: How do I hail a cab?
hints: Consult the sample transcript in your game manual.

children.title: Why does the growler cab get lost?

child.title: Why does the growler cab get lost?
hints: The driver is friendly, but stupid.
The driver is stupid, but friendly.
Give up. He'll never take you where you want to go.

children.title: Westminster Abbey

child.title: Westminster Abbey

children.title: Are the tombs important?

child.title: Are the tombs important?
hints: They are to the people buried in them.
Yes.

children.title: How do I make a brass rubbing?

child.title: How do I make a brass rubbing?
hints: Take a piece of paper from the pacquet of paper, put it on the tomb of your choice, and then rub it with the crayon.

children.title: What should I make rubbings of?

child.title: What should I make rubbings of?
hints: Do not read the next clue until you have solved the verses on the thief's clue paper.
The tombs of Queen Elizabeth, Sir Isaac Newton and Henry V.

children.title: Why am I making brass rubbings?

child.title: Why am I making brass rubbings?
hints: The thief is trying to send messages to Sherlock.
He wouldn't want his messages to be visible to everyone, now would he?
Have you visited the British Museum yet?
The book on the table in the British Museum contains a clue that will help you.
There is some invisible writing on some of the tombs.
When you make a rubbing, the invisible ink is transferred onto the back of the paper.
Invisible ink usually becomes visible when heated.
Heat the paper over the candles in the Evangelist Chapel.
Turn the paper over.

children.title: Where is the Stone of Scone?

child.title: Where is the Stone of Scone?
hints: It belongs under the Coronation Chair in Edward the Confessor's Chapel - but we knew it was going to be stolen in 1950 and then returned several months later. We figured that was enough excitement for any one rock, so we left it out of the game, safe from your grubby paws.

children.title: What's the Son of Mars answer?

child.title: What's the Son of Mars answer?
hints: Admiral Lord Nelson.

children.title: What's the Chopper answer?

child.title: What's the Chopper answer?
hints: Charles I.

children.title: What's the London Bridge answer?

child.title: What's the London Bridge answer?
hints: Under London Bridge.

children.title: What's the answer to life's riddle?

child.title: What's the answer to life's riddle?
hints: If we knew that, do you think we'd be sitting around writing games?

children.title: What's the Pussycat answer?

child.title: What's the Pussycat answer?
hints: Go to the Tower of London.

children.title: What's the Number answer?

child.title: What's the Number answer?
hints: Have you looked at the statue of William the Conqueror?
Have you read the sign on the Monument?
Have you ever read the Charge of the Light Brigade?

children.title: How about Hickory Dickory Dock?

child.title: How about Hickory Dickory Dock?
hints: Big Ben.

children.title: British Museum

child.title: British Museum

children.title: How do I get past the librarian?

child.title: How do I get past the librarian?
hints: Think of the room not as a museum, but as a library.
Have you read the sign on the librarian's desk?
Has it occurred to you that he's doing an awful lot of talking?
Tell him to be quiet.

children.title: St. Paul's

child.title: St. Paul's

children.title: What is a Whispering Gallery?

child.title: What is a Whispering Gallery?
hints: It is a place where you can eavesdrop on other people from far away.

children.title: How do I get up there?

child.title: How do I get up there?
hints: Take the stairs up from the clerestory.

children.title: How do I get to the clerestory?

child.title: How do I get to the clerestory?
hints: You can't. St Paul's isn't even in the game.
We just like the word clerestory.

children.title: Trafalgar Square

child.title: Trafalgar Square

children.title: Are the pigeons important?

child.title: Are the pigeons important?
hints: Only to other pigeons.

children.title: Is the statue important?

child.title: Is the statue important?
hints: Yes.
Have you looked at it?
Have you looked at it closely?
Have you looked at it through a telescope?

children.title: Is the column important?

child.title: Is the column important?
hints: Yes.
If it wasn't there, we'd have to come up with some other way of keeping the statue out of your reach.

children.title: Is anything important?

child.title: Is anything important?
hints: Like, wow, man. Heavy question!

children.title: On the Thames

child.title: On the Thames

children.title: How do I stop rowing in circles?

child.title: How do I stop rowing in circles?
hints: Has anyone told you you're not playing with a full deck?
Has anyone told you you're not rowing with both oars in the water?
You need two oars to steer the boat.
Don't read the next two clues unless you want to know where the other oar is.
The other oar is in another boat.
It's in Captain Bligh's boat in the Black Museum.

children.title: How do I stop the boat?

child.title: How do I stop the boat?
hints: Type, 'Whoa, Boat!'
Just kidding. Drop the anchor.

children.title: How do I launch the boat?

child.title: How do I launch the boat?
hints: Got any rocket fuel?
Type, 'Launch boat.'
(Make sure you're in the boat and the anchor's up first.)

children.title: How do I land the boat?

child.title: How do I land the boat?
hints: You can only land the boat at the Embankment or outside Traitor's Gate.
Type: N or LAND BOAT.

children.title: How do I get the paddle?

child.title: How do I get the paddle?
hints: You can't get the paddle when you're outside Traitor's Gate.
If you don't have the paddle, you need two oars to row back up the river.
If you're on the river without a paddle or both oars, you're making a big mistake.
You can only take the paddle after you've entered the Tower.

children.title: Can I stop the man taking the boat?

child.title: Can I stop the man taking the boat?
hints: No, you can't. But after all, it's his boat.

children.title: Victoria Station

child.title: Victoria Station

children.title: What time does the last train leave?

child.title: What time does the last train leave?
hints: The timetable is posted on the wall.

children.title: What track does it leave from?

child.title: What track does it leave from?
hints: Track 29.

children.title: How much is a round-trip ticket?

child.title: How much is a round-trip ticket?
hints: Why are you reading clues about a place that isn't even in the game?

children.title: Covent Garden

child.title: Covent Garden

children.title: What is the matter with the girl?

child.title: What is the matter with the girl?
hints: She has a bad heart.
Perhaps some medicine....
Be careful. Drugs are dangerous.

children.title: How do I revive her?

child.title: How do I revive her?
hints: Have you made a positive diagnosis?
Listen to the girl with your stethoscope.
If her heart is abnormally fast, give her something to slow it down.
An unusually fast heartbeat is known as tachycardia.
If her heart is abnormally slow, give her something to speed it up.
An unusually slow heartbeat is know as bradycardia.
Belladonna will speed up a slow heart.
Digitalis will slow down a fast heart.
The drugs are in your medicine bag.

children.title: Where is the stethoscope?

child.title: Where is the stethoscope?
hints: Where do most doctors carry their stethoscopes?
You are not most doctors.
You have it when you start the game.
Sorry about this. It turns out that Watson always carries his stethoscope in his hat. Really. (Read "A Scandal in Bohemia.")

children.title: Madame Tussaud's

child.title: Madame Tussaud's

children.title: How do I get past the guard dog?

child.title: How do I get past the guard dog?
hints: He won't let you carry any matches inside.
OK. So you already knew that.
He won't let you carry in any flames that he can see.
Alright, so you knew that too. How about flames that he can't see?
Something that burns without a flame, for example.
Like tobacco maybe.
Light the pipe, drop the match, and go on in.

children.title: What do I do with the axe?

child.title: What do I do with the axe?
hints: The axe doesn't do much except cut down on the number of other things you can carry.

children.title: How can I light the torch?

child.title: How can I light the torch?
hints: Light it from something that's already burning.
Light it from a burning piece of paper.
Light a piece of paper from the pipe, and then use it to light the torch.

children.title: Scotland Yard

child.title: Scotland Yard

children.title: Will Lestrade talk to me in his office?

child.title: Will Lestrade talk to me in his office?
hints: He doesn't like you.
He really doesn't like you.
What office?

children.title: Bank of England

child.title: Bank of England

children.title: How do I get inside the bank?

child.title: How do I get inside the bank?
hints: Despite the guard's assertions to the contrary, he can be bribed.
Give him something valuable.
Some gems might do the trick.
Give him the ruby, the sapphire, the emerald and the opal.

children.title: How do I get inside the vault?

child.title: How do I get inside the vault?
hints: The door has a combination lock on it.
The tumblers turn too quietly for you to hear without amplification.
Listen to the door with the stethoscope, and then turn the dial left or right.
A 'clunk' means you're going the wrong way.
A 'whirr' means you're going the right way.
A 'click' means you should reverse directions.
The combination is right twice, left once, right twice.

children.title: Which box should I open?

child.title: Which box should I open?
hints: Have you solved the second clue on Sir Isaac Newton's tomb?
Open box 600.

children.title: How do I open safety deposit boxes?

child.title: How do I open safety deposit boxes?
hints: Do you have any dynamite?
Try using a key.
The bank guard has it.
It's in his pocket.
How good a pickpocket are you?
How good a pickpocket are the people you know?
Ask Wiggins to steal it.

children.title: How can I stop the kidnapping?

child.title: How can I stop the kidnapping?
hints: Hire bodyguards.
Put Holmes in your medical bag.
You can't.

children.title: Diogenes Club

child.title: Diogenes Club

children.title: What does Mycroft want from me?

child.title: What does Mycroft want from me?
hints: Your blood?
Your first-born male child?
Sherlock's ring.

children.title: How do I get the token?

child.title: How do I get the token?
hints: Show any of the gems you have found to Sherlock.

children.title: Tower of London

child.title: Tower of London

children.title: How do I get into the Tower?

child.title: How do I get into the Tower?
hints: Give the password to the beefeater.
You must get the password from someone who has government connections.
Mycroft Holmes knows the password.
Don't continue unless Sherlock Holmes has been kidnapped.
Go to the Diogenes Club and ask for Mycroft. The butler will ask you for a token. Give him the token. Mycroft will appear and give you the password.
Return to the Tower and type GUARD, THE PASSWORD IS _____.

children.title: How do I get out of the Tower?

child.title: How do I get out of the Tower?
hints: The beefeater won't let you out. You must find another exit.
The only other way out is through Traitor's Gate.
The portcullis is operated by the chain above it.
You do not weigh enough to pull down the chain.
Put on the suit of armour in the dungeon of the White Tower and then pull on the chain.

children.title: Gems

child.title: Gems

children.title: Where is the diamond?

child.title: Where is the diamond?
hints: What diamond?

children.title: How do I get the diamond?

child.title: How do I get the diamond?
hints: See previous hint.

children.title: Where is the sapphire?

child.title: Where is the sapphire?
hints: Did you solve the Hickory Dickory Dock riddle?
It's stuck to the clapper of Big Ben.

children.title: How do I get the sapphire?

child.title: How do I get the sapphire?
hints: Have you tried driving a hook into the ceiling, throwing a rope over the hook, climbing up onto the rail, swinging across the hollow shaft while screaming like Tarzan, and grabbing the sapphire as you swing by?
Just asking.
Wait until the hour strikes. The clapper will swing your way.
You need to use your hands while the bell is ringing.
Put the cotton balls in your ears before the bell starts to ring.
The cotton balls are in the blue pill bottle.

children.title: Where is the ruby?

child.title: Where is the ruby?
hints: Did you solve the Son of Mars riddle?
It's somewhere in Trafalgar Square.
It's on the statue in Trafalgar Square.
It's in Nelson's blind eye.
You can discover it only by looking through the telescope.

children.title: How do I get the ruby?

child.title: How do I get the ruby?
hints: You can't get up there.
Someone - or something - else will have to get it for you.
Some kind of trained bird might do it.
Old Sherman, who lives in Pinchin Lane, trains animals.
Get the bird from Sherman. Take it to Trafalgar Square. Show the ruby to the pigeon, ask him to get it, and then let him go.
Do not read the next clue until you have done all of the above.
Did we mention that it's a homing pigeon?
Return to Sherman's shop and ask him about the bird.

children.title: Where is the emerald?

child.title: Where is the emerald?
hints: Did you solve the Chopper riddle?
It's in the Chamber of Horrors.
It's hidden in one of the statues.
It's in the wax head of Charles I.

children.title: How do I get the emerald?

child.title: How do I get the emerald?
hints: It's encased in wax. What springs to mind?
You need to melt the head.
You can't melt the head unless you remove it from the statue.
You need something that puts out enough heat to melt a big gob of wax.
The torch will melt the wax head.

children.title: Where is the sceptre?

child.title: Where is the sceptre?
hints: In the sceptre tank?
Sorry about that.
There is no sceptre.

children.title: How do I get the sceptre?

child.title: How do I get the sceptre?
hints: Dive into the sceptre tank.
Don't blame us. You're the one who keeps reading these bogus clues.

children.title: More Gems

child.title: More Gems

children.title: Where is the opal?

child.title: Where is the opal?
hints: Have you solved the London Bridge riddle?
It's in the clump of moss under London Bridge.

children.title: How do I get the opal?

child.title: How do I get the opal?
hints: Can you lower the bridge?
Can you raise the water?
Wait for high tide.
The newspaper that came with your game contains the tide tables for the weekend.

children.title: Where is the zorkmid?

child.title: Where is the zorkmid?
hints: It's in the... oops. Sorry. Wrong game.

children.title: How do I get the zorkmid?

child.title: How do I get the zorkmid?
hints: Buy Zork I.
Buy Enchanter.
Buy Sorcerer.
You get the idea.

children.title: Where is the topaz?

child.title: Where is the topaz?
hints: In a safety deposit box in the Bank of England.
Have you solved the number riddle?
It's in box 600.

children.title: How do I get the topaz?

child.title: How do I get the topaz?
hints: See the clues for the Bank of England.

children.title: Where is the garnet?

child.title: Where is the garnet?
hints: Did you solve the Tower of London riddle?
It's in the butt of malmsey in the Bowyer Tower.

children.title: How do I get the garnet?

child.title: How do I get the garnet?
hints: Have you tried drinking the wine?
Pretty tasty stuff, isn't it?
You need to drain the keg somehow.
You need to remove the bung.
Knock out the bung with the mace.
Don't read the next clue until you have done all of the above.
Ask Wiggins to get the garnet for you.

children.title: Why are the gems important?

child.title: Why are the gems important?
hints: You don't think the thief has been hiding gems all over London just for the fun of it, do you?
Perhaps he is trying to send Sherlock yet another message.
Have you looked at any of the gems?
Have you looked at any of them closely?
Look at each of the gems through the magnifying glass.

children.title: The Lair

child.title: The Lair

children.title: Can I stop Akbar's knocking me out?

child.title: Can I stop Akbar's knocking me out?
hints: Knock him out first.
Perhaps you could smuggle something in.
Have you noticed the henchman's religion?
He probably won't disturb your hat.
Perhaps the etherium ampoule....

children.title: Can I stop Moriarty when I wake up?

child.title: Can I stop Moriarty when I wake up?
hints: If he is free to move around, he will always win.
Tie him up.
Don't forget to tie up the henchman, too.

children.title: Miscellaneous

child.title: Miscellaneous

children.title: Why do I finish without 100 points?

child.title: Why do I finish without 100 points?
hints: If you play the game from start to finish and solve all the puzzles, you will end up with 100 points. If, however, you start the game and play through it using information you acquired in a previous session, you may have neglected to perform a few actions for which you received points. This should not be of concern to anyone who is content with failing to discover the highest ranking available to the game player.

children.title: Can I abbreviate "stethoscope"?

child.title: Can I abbreviate "stethoscope"?
hints: Yes. It can be abbreviated to STETH or SS.

children.title: What is the square root of 64?

child.title: What is the square root of 64?
hints: Eight.
